name: V3 Data type PIVL_TS (PeriodicIntervalOfTime)
description: An interval of time that recurs periodically. Periodic intervals have two properties, phase and period. The phase specifies the "interval prototype" that is repeated every period.

element.label: Exceptional Value Detail
element.definition: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.

element.label: Phase
element.definition: A prototype of the repeating interval, specifying the duration of each occurrence and anchors the periodic interval sequence at a certain point in time.

element.label: Period
element.definition: A time duration specifying as a reciprocal measure of the frequency at which the periodic interval repeats.

element.label: Alignment to the Calendar
element.definition: Specifies if and how the repetitions are aligned to the cycles of the underlying calendar (e.g., to distinguish every 30 days from "the 5th of every month".) A non-aligned periodic interval recurs independently from the calendar. An aligned periodic interval is synchronized with the calendar.

element.label: Institution Specified Timing
element.definition: Indicates whether the exact timing is up to the party executing the schedule (e.g., to distinguish "every 8 hours" from "3 times a day".)
